thread.title: Dad-of-three dies during 24-hour video game marathon he was livestreaming online for Make A Wish Foundation
thread.title_full: Dad-of-three dies during 24-hour video game marathon he was livestreaming online for Make A Wish Foundation

author: Natalie Evans
title: Dad-of-three dies during 24-hour video game marathon he was livestreaming online for Make A Wish Foundation
text:
Brian Vigneault died during a 24-hour charity video game marathon (Photo: Facebook/Brianvigneault) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Police are probing the death of a dad-of-three who died during a 24-hour charity video game marathon he was livestreaming online. 
Brian Vigneault, 35, is believed to have taken a break 22 hours into playing World of Tanks to raise money for the Make-A-Wish Foundation on Twitch.tv. 
Viewers grew concerned when Vigneault, from Virginia, failed to return from smoking a cigarette at 3.30am (9.30am GMT). 
He was found unresponsive at his Virginia Beach home later that evening and was pronounced dead at the scene, the Sun reported. Read More Young dad-to-be who died suddenly will be buried with unborn baby in devastating double family tragedy Vigneault was a dad-of-three (Photo: Facebook/Brianvigneault) 
Virginia Beach police spokeswoman Tonya Borman said police do not suspect foul play but gave no further details surrounding his death. 
The father-of-three's Twitch profile says he had raised nearly $11,000 for various charities during his five-year streaming career. Read More (Photo: Facebook/Brianvigneault) 
The gaming community Fame paid tribute on its Facebook page. 
It wrote: "Sad news from Virginia beach, one of the most famous NA streamers and a member of our clan Poshybrid has passed away at the age of 35. 
"We just can not find words to describe how sad is this moment for all of us and for sure this game will not be the same without the legend. 
"Maybe the saddest lines can not really be written , and the saddest thoughts can not really be uttered, let's all hope that he is in a better place right now and may his soul Rest in Peace, he will never be forgotten. 
"A person who stays in our hearts never dies." Like us on Facebook
